patterns: i'd like to know about msp
responses: MSP stands for Medical Services Plan. Its a health insurance program managed by the government for people
MSP pays for things like doctors appointments, appointments with specialist doctors like psychiatrists, and hospital stays you need to treat a medical problem.
You pay a monthly fee based on your income. Some workplaces cover the costs of MSP fees for you

patterns: how do i know am i mentally defected
how to figure out i am autistic
responses: It is estimated that mental illness affects 3 in 5 adults in America.
Mental illness does not discriminate; it can affect anyone, regardless of gender, age, income, social status, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, or background.
Although mental illness can affect anyone, certain conditions may be more common in different populations. For instance, eating disorders tend to occur more often in females
When these occur in children under 18, they are referred to as serious emotional disturbances

patterns: What's the difference between psychotherapy and counselling?
which type of medication i should seek ?
how to figure out which session works for me
should i get a checkup or two even tho i don't have any issues
responses: Psychotherapy and counselling have a lot in common and usually mean the same thing.
Both are used to describe professionals who use talk-based approaches to help someone recover from a mental illness or mental health problem
Its useful to talk to someone about any problems lot of people find that simply talking with friends or family can help them feel better.
They use different theories to listen to you, support you

There are many psychotherapies with good evidence of being effective for different problems or illnesses. A few examples include cognitive-behavioural therapy, interpersonal therapy,dialectical behaviour therapy, solutions-focused brief psychotherapy, narrative therapy, and emotion-focused therapy
If you need to talk to someone i am here
call 1-800-SUICIDE (1-800-784-2433) at any time
1-800-SUICIDE (1-800-784-2433)They can help you, and they can suggest good local resources

patterns: Someone I love has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. How can I help
i've found some people ofen talk to their imaginary friends after their child hood
i talk to someone in my head do i have some sort of illnes in me
responses: We naturally want to help a loved one who isn't feeling well.
are you not sure how to best help when a loved one experiences a mental illness like schizophrenia. Here are some tips:
You don't have to be an expert in schizophrenia, but learning more can help you understand what's going on
Our Schizophrenia info sheet is a great place to start. You can also find a lot of information from the BC Schizophrenia Society
Sometimes talking about problems or concerns can really helps :)

It's important to understand that talking about something difficult like experiences of schizophrenia can be very hard for your loved one's and the symptoms of schizophrenia can also make conversations difficult. If a loved one opens up to you, listen actively that is, without distractions
patterns: is there any help i can provide to the person?
How can I find help for an alcohol or drug use problem?
responses: Seeking to make changes in the way you use substances like alcohol
The right help for you depends on many factors.
One way to get help is to talk to a doctor you trust and feel comfortable confiding in.

patterns: Someone I care about has a brain injury
where i can find infromation about brain injury
responses: A brain injury itself same as a mental illness
someone who experiences a brain injury may also experience mental health problems
These mental health problems may stem from the injury itself or from thoughts around the injury (like feelings of loss, anger, or frustration when quality of life changes)
In some cases, mental health challenges may not be related to a brain injury at all
For more information and support, visit the BC Brain Injury Association.
